results.title: The Earth and mankind
results.brief_description: A series of six films which provide a comprehensive survey and review of the world’s population and food supply. The films show that already the problem transcends national boundaries, threatening man’s survival.

results.title: Can the earth provide?
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
When the earth’s capacity to produce meat and potatoes, wheat, rice or corn is exhausted, will science be able to feed us? Sea plankton, algae, hydroponics, synthetics - all hold great potential for development. But the vital questions are: How much? How soon? Animation: Rene Jodoin, Kaj Pindal Narrated by Stanley Burke.

results.title: To each a rightful share
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
This, to the privileged, is a fine-sounding principle; but to the underprivileged it is a call to action. Riots in Africa, India’s violence, China’s new dynamism, Japan’s intense industrialization - all these are seen as part of a great movement. Good historical overview of the rise of industrialization, with particular emphasis on the social affects (the growth in wealth brought on by industrialization).

results.title: The Enlightenment
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: The Marriage of Figaro
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Enlightenment”.
Consists of three scenes from Beaumarchais’ play “The Marriage of Figaro” and the same scenes from Mozart’s opera. The following scenes are performed - Act V. Part of Figaro’s monologue and part of Figaro’s aria. Act III. The duet between the Count and Susanna. Act II. Part of the scene in which Susanna is discovered in the Countess’s dressing room.(the beginning of the finale of Act II of the opera).

results.title: Changes in its surface
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth”.
Uses the illustration of an erupting volcano to show that the surface of the earth is changing. Explains and demonstrates other forces both internal and external that are changing the earth’s surface.

results.title: Volcanoes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth”.
Evidence of high termperature and pressure beneath the earth’s surface is seen in bubbling mud pots, hot spering geysers, lava fountains and thunderous volcanic eruptions. Further effects of volcanic action on the earth’s crust are seen in cinder cones, crater lakes, calderas, shield and strato-volcanoes.

results.title: Resources in its crust
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth”.
The major useful organic and mineral substances found in the earth’s crust. Classifies the resources as the metallic minerals, the non-metallic minerals, and the mineral fuels. How some of them are extracted and processed. Steps necessary to conserve irreplaceable resources.

results.title: The Passing of remoteness
results.creator_credit: Robert Hone, WGBH Productions and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The dream machine”.
Computers are continuously changing the way humans interact and have become an integral part of our lives, however, technology often comes into conflict with social systems. This program examines the way “Information Technology” has impacted on our everyday lives, raising controversial issues relating to the monitoring of individuals and their right to privacy, disruptions caused by faulty data and the catastrophic effect of software errors. Looks at Singapore’s “Information Technology Society”, France’s national computer network and the effect of “Electronic Trading” in Stock Markets. Our future is Digital but will technology control humans?
